content.question: The figures shown illustrate the images formed when a real object is placed in front of a spherical mirror at a distance that is less than the magnitude of the focal length. Which of the following is a correct conclusion from the two figures shown?

choices.label: The image formed by the concave mirror is virtual and enlarged, while the image formed by the convex mirror is real and reduced in size.
The image formed by the concave mirror is real and reduced in size, while the image formed by the convex mirror is virtual and enlarged.
The image formed by both concave and convex mirrors is virtual, but the image formed by the concave mirror is enlarged, while the image formed by the convex mirror is reduced in size.
The image formed by both concave and convex mirrors is enlarged, but the image formed by the concave mirror is virtual, while the image formed by the convex mirror is real.

content.answer: The image formed by both concave and convex mirrors is virtual, but the image formed by the concave mirror is enlarged, while the image formed by the convex mirror is reduced in size.
